forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 59. West southwest wind around 2 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 75, with temperatures falling to around 71 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 2 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this Tuesday, Downtown San Francisco greets a partly cloudy sky, wrapping the city in a gentle embrace of cool air. The temperature lingers around a mild 59 degrees, with a whisper of wind meandering from the west southwest at a mere two miles per hour. A few delicate clouds dance above, creating a subtle tapestry against the vast starlit expanse, leaving space for the promise of a sun-soaked day ahead.

As the sun begins its ascent, it heralds an invigorating warmth. The forecast offers a delightful high of near 75, with temperatures dipping to a more tempered 71 in the afternoon. The wind will pick up, stirring to 12 mph, caressing the streets and inviting city dwellers to step outside. While the allure of a sunlit afternoon is undeniable, one may still catch hints of the marine layer tucked away in the bay, a reminder of the calm, cool influence of the Pacific. For the day's adventures, a light jacket paired with comfortable layers will suffice, allowing for easy adjustment as the warmth unfolds. With this pleasant trek through urban landscapes on the horizon, perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero or a quiet moment in a neighborhood café beckons, bringing the simple joys of the day into focus.
